definition: to relax/to slacken/relaxation (in nuclear magnetic resonance)
to unstring a bow/to slacken/to relax/to loosen
slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate

sentences.english: Aim To evaluate the effect of endoscopic balloon dilation for achalasia.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討內鏡下氣囊擴張治療賁門失弛緩症的療效。

sentences.english: I was 30 years old when I was diagnosed with achalasia.
sentences.chinese: 我30歲的時候，我被診斷爲賁門失弛緩症。

sentences.english: They coined the term achalasia, meaning failure to relax.
sentences.chinese: 他們創造了長期失弛緩症，這意味着沒有放鬆。

sentences.english: That includes the flaccid and forgettable Mr. Big played by Paul Giamatti.
sentences.chinese: 這包括弛緩性和遺忘的大先生的保羅吉亞瑪提播放。

sentences.english: Affect when haemorrhage when two side, appear two flank paralysis and limb atony the gender breaks down.
sentences.chinese: 當出血波及兩側時，出現兩側面癱和四肢弛緩性癱瘓。

sentences.english: Manometric evaluation of the esophagus in a patient with achalasia.
sentences.chinese: 測壓評價食管賁門失弛緩症病人，在1。

sentences.english: The incidence of achalasia is approximately 1 per 100,000 people per year.
sentences.chinese: 賁門失弛緩症的發病率約爲每年每10萬1人。

sentences.english: I suffered from achalasia for the last 25 years.
sentences.chinese: 我遭受失弛緩症在過去25年。

sentences.english: I have had achalasia since I was 7 years old.
sentences.chinese: 我已經失弛緩症，因爲我是7歲。
